stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.

Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Tuesday Night Trollball: Winners Bracket Game 2! üèüÔ∏è

Well, pull up a gravestone and crack a rib, folks! It‚Äôs your favorite voice from the void, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the eerie, mist-choked ruins of The Old Fort! We are deep in the heart of the Winners Bracket, and let me tell you, the playoff atmosphere is thicker than the fog rolling off these ancient stones! The Oread's Summit Tamers are sitting pretty with a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series, and if they take it today, the Kerlauger Runeguard will be packing their bags for the Losers Bracket faster than Sir Tanos runs from a book! 

Down on the field, the rituals are in full swing! I see Saloma Talich of the Tamers getting absolutely hammered in the shoulder by a teammate‚Äînow that‚Äôs how you wake up the nerves! Meanwhile, the Runeguard‚Äôs own Lashondra Niehaus is doing the same; it‚Äôs a regular punch-fest down there! Johnna Beetner is prowling the perimeter, adding another pebble to her collection from these ancient ruins. She‚Äôs going to need more than luck to handle the Tamers today, especially with the 'Ancient Ruins' modifier making every step a potential ankle-snapper! 

The crowd is hushed, or maybe they're just lost in the 'Dense Fog,' but you can feel the tension! Dame Terra Monteforte is watching from the high stones, looking as stern as a schoolmarm at a mud-wrestling match. Can the Runeguard use their home-field advantage to force a Game 3, or will the Tamers provide us with the beautiful sight of a series sweep? The runes are glowing, the troll head is twitching, and the violence is about to begin! Let‚Äôs get to the mayhem! ü¶¥üí•
postGame:
# üèÜ Post-Game Report: Tamers Sweep the Series! üèîÔ∏è

Great gobs of gore, what a finish! The Oread's Summit Tamers have done it, folks! They‚Äôve marched into the fog of Kerlauger and emerged victorious with a 2-1 win over the Runeguard, clinching this Winners Bracket series 2-0! It was a tactical masterclass in brutality that would make Lord Orzalon weep with pride! The Kerlauger Runeguard put up a fight, but they‚Äôll be heading down to the Losers Bracket to contemplate their failures while the Tamers climb higher toward glory! 

The action kicked off with Saloma Talich snagging the troll head right out of the gate in Center Field! The Tamers wasted no time showing why they‚Äôre the favorites. Swamy Ahasuerus tore through the fog like a banshee, and before the Runeguard could even find their footing on the 'Uneven Footing,' Zadoc Wyatan let fly a massive Shoot from Home Field! Swish! Two points for the Tamers, and the Runeguard were looking like they‚Äôd seen a ghost! 

But oh, the violence that followed! Dric Trilley decided Lashondra Niehaus didn't need to be standing anymore, delivering a tackle that sent her straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! The Tamers were on a warpath! Mitran Mariand followed up by absolutely leveling Vivia Namara. It was like watching a butcher shop during a fire sale‚Äîbodies everywhere! The Runeguard's offense was sputtering in the 'Dense Fog,' unable to string a pass together without a Tamer turning them into a rug!

Mitran Mariand wasn't done, folks! He caught Johnna Beetner trying to escape with a pebble in her pocket and sent her to the sidelines with a crunch that echoed off the ancient standing stones! The Runeguard were dropping like flies! Even Reginauld Cordell couldn't catch a break, as Edme Virgil Tackled him into the dirt just before the half. It was a symphony of destruction that would make Sir Artorias blush‚Äîif that celebrity could even remember what a real fight looked like! 

We went into Halftime with the Tamers leading 2-0 and the Runeguard looking like they‚Äôd been through a meat grinder. But credit where it‚Äôs due, Eal Caundra worked some magic in the tent! When the whistle blew for the second half, the Runeguard showed a flicker of life! Gurney Fadiman scooped the ball, and Vivia Namara, back from the brink, made a desperate dash into the End Zone for a Touchdown! The score narrowed to 2-1, and for a moment, I thought we might actually see a comeback! 

However, the Oread‚Äôs Summit defense tightened up faster than a hangman‚Äôs noose! Kass Fogel secured the ball in Center Field and the Tamers began a brutal game of keep-away. Every time the Runeguard tried to mount an attack, the terrain or a Tamer stopped them cold. Harilda Sigsmond managed to take out Odericus Juxon, but it was too little, too late. The Runeguard were fighting the fog as much as their opponents! 

The frustration was palpable! Odericus Juxon tried to put the game away with a Shoot from Home Field but missed, sending the ball skittering into the mist. Johnna Beetner tried one last desperate pass to save their playoff lives, but the clock was the real enemy here. The Runeguard were running out of time and healthy bodies to throw at the problem! 

In the final moments, Zadoc Wyatan decided to put an exclamation point on the victory by crushing Reginauld Cordell one more time! Talk about adding insult to injury! Reginauld's going to be feeling that one well into next season! The Runeguard fans‚Äîall zero of them in the stands‚Äîmust be devastated, while the Tamers celebrate a series well-won! 

Final Score: Oread's Summit Tamers 2, Kerlauger Runeguard 1. The Tamers move forward in the Winners Bracket, looking like the juggernaut we all suspected they were! They didn't even need the thin air of the mountains to suffocate the competition today; they just used good old-fashioned steel and grit! 

As for the Runeguard, they‚Äôll have plenty of time to collect pebbles in the Losers Bracket. Maybe Dame Terra Monteforte can use some of her dirt wizardry to bury the memory of this loss! They‚Äôll need a miracle and a lot more armor if they want to survive the next round. I hope they enjoy the long walk home through the mud! 

This has been Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that in Trollball, if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! Congratulations to the Tamers for the sweep! Tune in next time when we see who else gets their dreams crushed under a spiked boot! Stay brutal, Osterra! üèüÔ∏èüíÄüî•
